content:
That's a great plan! Attending workshops and seminars regularly can help you stay motivated, learn new skills, and network with others in your field. It's excellent that you've already registered for an online course on data analysis, and I'm sure you'll find ways to apply your new skills to your project at work.

Data analysis is a valuable skill that can help you make more informed decisions and drive business results. By combining your improved public speaking skills with your new data analysis skills, you'll be able to present your findings more effectively and make a greater impact at work.

Remember to also practice your public speaking skills regularly, even if it's just for a few minutes a day. You can try recording yourself, speaking in front of a mirror, or practicing with a friend or family member. Consistency is key when it comes to improving your public speaking skills.

It's also great that you're thinking about how you can apply your new skills to your current project at work. Being able to apply what you've learned to real-world situations is a great way to reinforce your learning and see the value of your hard work.

What specific aspects of data analysis are you most interested in learning about in your online course? Are there any particular tools or techniques you're looking forward to learning about?

Also, have you thought about how you can share your new skills and knowledge with others at work? You might consider leading a training session or brown-bag lunch to share your expertise and help others improve their skills as well.
